rebased
Thanks @DrahtBot . Rather than continually rebase this large PR, I've split the first three commits into #14023.\n\nReviewers, please review that first.
The 'account' RPC has been removed in #14023. This PR removes all dead code left behind by that PR.
Care to fix https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/14023#discussion_r213136227?

utACK .. but mostly I just like the PR text.

utACK 85ec8d645f9aace793514ab36d6cc7a5382f3e7c\n\nSome of the changes for the "GetLabelDestination" commit (53038b47) are actually in the following "Delete unused account functions" commit, causing "make all" to fail. Otherwise looks good.

4 utACKs. Rather than fix the build break in the intermediate commit, I think it makes sense to just squash everything down to one commit (I only split it up so granularly to aid reviews).\n\n@laanwj - if you agree, I'm happy for you to squash these down when you merge, or I can do it. Let me know.
@jnewbery ok, I'll do that, no problem
This was squashed to c9c32e6b844fc79467b7e24c6c916142a0d08484 and merged
yep\nI should probably have left the `[doc]` commit separate, nah\n

Hi, this is a real pity that you have removed the "accounts" functionality. Many platforms have been designed around this as to "move" and "sendfrom" between accounts  Is there a discussion somewhere where one can see the reasoning behind removing this functionality?

> Hi, this is a real pity that you have removed the "accounts" functionality. Many platforms have been designed around this as to "move" and "sendfrom" between accounts Is there a discussion somewhere where one can see the reasoning behind removing this functionality?\n\nI fully agree with you. This is close minded mentality, not looking at all side of the story, only at green users and miners s

@inzider The accounts functionality we had almost certainly did not what you would expect it to do. It never supported moving coins between addresses, for example. You may be interested in the more modern multiwallet feature that supports having multiple truly independent wallets simultaneously.

I appreciate the suggestion and this is exactly what I DON'T want.
I'm looking at one wallet with multiple addresses as in the core code. 

I'm using a code that is based on bitcoin (multichain) and sendfrom does exactly that! 
Moving fund from one address to the other in the same wallet.

This is useful is MANY situation - I could write a novel on it.

Refer to : https://stackover

I don't understand use-case described https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/13825#issuecomment-624990913, since sendfrom didn't control coin selection and had no influence on what addresses (so to speak) would be sent from. It only affected how account balances were computed.\n\nIf there's an actual use-case made more difficult by removing accounts, it'd be good to open a feature request to se
